availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Kentucky Adair County Sct.
County Court February Term 1863

It appearing to the Satisfaction of the Court that there is a vacany in the office of Justice of the peace in District No 4 in this County occasioned by the death of William F Grady former Justice in said District, Therefore it is ordered that the fact of such vacancy be certified to the Governor of this State

A Copy Test
John W. Butler C, A, C, C

Kentucky Adair County Sct
County Court February Term 1863

It appearing to the satisfaction of the Court that there is a vacancy in the office of Justice of the Peace in District No 1 in this County occasioned by the removal of George W Ewing former Justice in said District out of said District -- Therefore it is ordered that the fact of such vacancy be certified to the Governor of this State

A Copy
Attest John W. Butler C. A. C. C.

Adair Co
Commission first named man in each district & enclose to Presd Judge
J. P.
Dist No 1. & 5. 1863
Feby 6. 1863
